ETYMOLOGY: From New Latin phobia, from Ancient Greek φόβος (phóbos, “fear, panic, fright, terror”).

MEANINGS.PATTERN: a phobia of [sth] | a phobia about [sth]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An extreme or irrational fear of or aversion to something, often a specific object, situation, or living thing.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对某事物（常指特定的物体、情境或生物）极端或非理性的恐惧或厌恶。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She developed a phobia of flying after the accident.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那次事故后，她对飞行产生了恐惧症。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A strong dislike or aversion for something, used in a less clinical or informal sense.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对某事物强烈的厌恶或排斥，常用于非正式或非临床语境。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He has a phobia of public speaking, even though he's a great presenter one-on-one.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他很害怕公开演讲，尽管他一对一讲解时表现出色。
